intro: Fagraea khasiana, commonly known as the Khasi fagraea, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Meliaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are usually greenish-yellow with a distinctive scent, attracting various pollinators. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
